data.title: A Happening Place!
data.text: Nice ambiance. Was a concert night on 4th street so very busy. However, the service was still solid. Our waiter was attentive. One of our party tried a new drink and didnt like it so he hooked her up with a new one. Had fish and chips. Very good, but small portions.

data.title: Place Smelled and you stuck to the floors.
data.text: We went on Saturday around 6:30pm.  Place was empty.  As we were walking to the bar we seriously stuck to the floor.  We sat at the bar, had to move down a few seats as my husbands arms stuck to the bar.  The older guy and his wife we sat next to at the bar asked us if we thought the floor was sticky and we said yes. So he asked the bartender and he just played it off like it was the cleaning crews fault.  We ordered Bud Light Draft...Out, Mic Ultra...Out, Sam Adams...Out, the bartender just joked and said must of been busy last night.  As a business don't you think you should check your draft beer before you open? Anyway, as we were sitting there we were smelling this horrible smell. We narrowed it down to 1) The glass cabinet- Glasses were upside down with the rim on the bottom of the cabinet.  I noticed the dirt, and dust and who knows what else and ask for a straw. 2) The moldy, dusty, nasty motor on the cooler.  It seemed like every time they opened it, we smelled "the smell". 3) Could have been the nasty Tabs from the draft beer that looked like mold could grow any second, or trip catchers under them that when I leaned over the bar seen "junk" floating in them.  4) Every time we tried to move our feet and unstick them from the floor "The Smell" returned.  I lasted an hour here...an hour too long! Thank Goodness I didn't order any food!!!!!

data.title: Very Good Pub food
data.text: We had a Rueben and their specialty salad, and both were very good.  We'd recommend this restaurant for lunch.

data.title: Ok drinks...Ok atmosphere
data.text: We had a good time here but the drinks were just OK.  The food is just bar food and seemed high priced for what it was.  We decided not to eat here.  However, the patio tables are right in front of the 4th street stage.  That was a lot of fun.  The live music with a cocktail was what we were looking for!

data.title: Danced the night away.....
data.text: Good company, good beer and a great DJ. We had a blast dancing the night away. Thursday night was busy but not packed and we enjoyed our late night.

data.title: Lots of better options in Fourth Street Live
data.text: Not impressed with anything about Sully's.  There was maybe eight people in the restaurant and yet we have horrible service.  A few of the plates had bits of food on them when they were finally delivered to us for our appetizer and the food really wasn't even that good.  One person ordered a beer, they were going to change the keg, and finally about 15 minutes later when we asked about it, she said he would just need to pick another beer.  I'm honestly surprised they stay in business with the poor level of customer service and food quality.  It's a good location, but there are many better places to choose from in Fourth Street Live!

data.title: Don't Bother..........
data.text: If you want any level of service at all, don't bother.  Went there early on a Saturday evening, when it was not very busy.  Ordered our food, then never saw the server after that.  After 40 minutes, I was told they were getting ready for a big group to come in.  45 minutes, got the food, but no utensils, or napkins.  Food was average - service was the worst I have ever experienced.

data.title: Great good and atmosphere!
data.text: I had the buffalo chicken quesadilla and my boyfriend had the BBQ cheeseburger. Both amazing! Our waitress was so friendly and we had a great time. A little slow on getting our meal paid for, but I guess there were some technical issues.

data.title: Location yes- food, not so much
data.text: The location is right near the live stage on 4th street which is great during a show, but the food was terrible. The nachos tasted stale, the meat on my salad was rolled lunch meat. The service was decent, but I wouldn't bother to eat there.

data.title: cocktails on the patio
data.text: Great spot to sit on patio and watch 4th street concerts, appetizers were great, and decent price for drinks, bar crowd changes at dark though to very young crowd playing beer pong.

data.title: A Lot of Unexpected Fun!
data.text: The bar wasn't too busy since it was a Monday night, but the bartender was great and the DJ played music we wanted to hear. Drinks were reasonably priced too! I would go back.

data.title: Quick bite and drink for Monday afternoon
data.text:
I guess the rain and being the fact that it was Monday before 3pm, had to do something with the dead ambiance of the restaurant.  There was only one person at the bar and 3 other people sitting outside.  

So plenty of seating to choose from, the bartender quick to take our orders.  The food was ok. The menu limited but ok, some burgers/sandwiches, salad, appetizers and bees/cocktails.

I bet this place might be fun in the evening but if you go there before 5, it is pretty quite.

data.title: 7 Days till DERBY !
data.text:
This review is based on drinks only.  

If your looking for a place to party on 4th street, this place really couldn't have done much else to get a higher score.  Know what your going for, a night of cheap drink drinks, shots from test tubes, dance music, and people dancing on the bar.  If this is what you want, this is where to go.  Also, it is young crowd (early 20's).

data.title: College party!
data.text: Great music! Be prepared to party hard with all the youngsters there! Dance the night away...you know the rest!

data.title: Meat market I presume
data.text: This is probably just a meat market for hormonal youths, unfortunately my party made the mistake in eating here. If you are not looking to score this is probably not the place. Why don't I read reviews from trip advisor more while traveling?

data.title: Such great fun!
data.text: Great bar, great DJ, and great dancing. Drink prices are average, and the pours were above average. I did not eat here, so this review is only in regards to the late night bar scene. It was a super great time, not to be missed if going to 4th Street Live.

data.title: great place
data.text: Great place to hang and watch the game or have few with some friends. staff is verty attentive and freindly.

data.title: Don't eat here
data.text: Waited FOREVER for a burger that was a pre-made frozen patty. Service was slow. Doesn't look like they'll be in business much longer.

data.title: A Little disappointed
data.text: Looking foreward to an Irish Pub.  Should have tried the other two in Fourth Street Live.  This one was not very good.  Not fast nor overly friendly either.

data.title: Can't Stay Away
data.text: Pretty good Irish/Pub like food. More of a late night atmosphere. Definitely the best party bar in Louisville! Great music lots of fun! The staff is super friendly and has a great time. More of a college bar but a wide range of people end up there. Even after I graduated college it is still one of my favorite places to go!
